title: What's the difference between a University and State University? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the United States there are private universities and public universities. The public universities usually are state (meaning, ‘owned’ and run by the particular state), but there are a few public city universities (such as City University of New York, in New York City). The qualities within private and within public/state range in quality. Top private universities include Harvard, Yale, Stanford M.I.T., Cal Tech, while top public/state universities include Universities of California-Berkeley, U of Michigan, U of Virginia, U of Texas at Austin. All top notch schools, but there are lesser private and state/public universities. The ones I just mentioned are ‘elite’ ones. I went to both an ‘elite’ state school (University of Wisconsin-Madison) and ‘elite’ private university (Northwestern University) and thought the education and competition was similar. However, the U of Wisconsin was huge, with TONS of students. If you want a small school experience, don’t go to a major state school. As state universities are designed to educate the public, they are usually much larger (more students) than private universities and you’ll get more ‘normal’ people.
